p: Ehrlichia canis suspensions were standardized at 800 cells/well with a 70% infection rate using 96-well culture plates. Solutions of the tested products were used in concentrations determined from their respective IC 50 The protocol used to determine the antimicrobial effect of the essential oil and doxycycline were an adaptation from Rolain et al. ( 1998) and Rolain et al. ( 2002) regarding serial dilutions 0.0625 0.25, 0.5 and 1 times the respective IC 50 value that was determined for each treatment. Initially, we added 200 μL of medium into each well of a sterile microplate. Subsequently, 50 μL of each product tested in serial dilutions were arranged in an orderly fashion so that we were able to evaluate activity according to the decrease of the essential oil and the synthetic drug. From top to bottom, there is decrease of the essential oil IC 50, and horizontally from the right to the left there is a decrease of the synthetic drug (Nightingale et al. 2007).
